metadata.dc:description: Over the past 15 years, endoscopic variceal sclerotherapy (EVS) has become the main therapy for patients with bleeding esophageal varices. EVS has the advantage of a low associated mortality and morbidity, but may lead to serious complications. We report a case of esophagotracheal fistula complicating sclerotherapy that resolved with nonsurgical management.
metadata.dc:title: Fístula traqueoesofágica secundaria a escleroterapia endoscópica de varices esofágicas.
[Tracheoesophageal fistula secondary to endoscopic sclerotherapy of esophageal varices].
metadata.dc:publisher: Revista espanola de enfermedades digestivas : organo oficial de la Sociedad Espanola de Patologia Digestiva
